TopicTitle: The times the Kraken says NEIN.

Articles.Content:
In this thread you post any fails or kraken attacks.Photos allowed.

Here is mine.

One rather cute Kraken that happened to me in VAB:

The craft would move just fine, but the nodes refused to budge.

 

 

Kraken incoming: The decoupler separated from both sides, and didn't disconnect the struts, which keep streeeetching...
As I don't need that part (decoupled launch stage), I just go about my business happily, assembling the orbital tug without any care in the world.

Until my tug is no more. Suddenly every single joint failed.

 

 

And here, from the times Klaw was a big kraken bait, there were at least 7 klaws attached to this asteroid...

 

Want a small creepypasta?

Attaching launch clamps to a keosynchronous satellite - ground speed zero, so the game doesn't protest...

\

...but it summons the Kraken, which is very hard to avoid, and you really shouldn't do some things before reloading the game. Like boarding a craft.

 

Quote

 

 Why you shouldn't board the craft... The engineer's soul gets in and takes over the ship, while the dead husk of his body floats away.

Specifically: Bill grabs the hatch, I press 'B'. Bill seems to be still on the ladder, but the focus goes to the craft. The game says 'Controlling: Bill Kerman'. There's no IVA picure in the corner, but I'm clearly in control of the ship. I can click 'transfer crew' and I see Bill Kerman and 'Transfer', but no 'EVA'. Pressing 'c' doesn't show the inside; I can fire the engines, turn the craft etc. But on the map, the craft is shown as a Kerbal icon.

Meanwhile, the kerbal on the hatch lets go and floats away. I try to switch, focus, can't. See on map - nope. That's a dead husk of Bill Kerman, while Bill currently is the ship.

 

 

And what about the Shadow Kerbin? Pic just for a teaser, read the linked post.

Side effects included all celestial bodies except of Kerbin vanishing. No Sun, ever again.

I don't have pics, but i was recently attacked by not one, but two krakens: First the hell kraken and then the warp kraken (see it on wiki). When i launched a massive cluster of boosters for no apparent reason, and as soon as i launched, it exploded. I quickloaded, but then my xbox screen went white, the navball went black, and i shot through kerbin at roughly 2.789 times the speed of light. I have no idea why, but it never repeated for me.

lol
Ah,spaghettification.Isnt it b̶e̶a̶u̶t̶i̶f̶u̶l̶  TERRIFYING?!

On 2/10/2017 at 10:49 AM, Lemurs of Kerbin said:

I don't have pics, but i was recently attacked by not one, but two krakens: First the hell kraken and then the warp kraken (see it on wiki). When i launched a massive cluster of boosters for no apparent reason, and as soon as i launched, it exploded. I quickloaded, but then my xbox screen went white, the navball went black, and i shot through kerbin at roughly 2.789 times the speed of light. I have no idea why, but it never repeated for me.

lol

Roughly 2.789x the speed of light. Roughly

On 2/28/2017 at 3:04 PM, Cadet_BNSF said:

Roughly 2.789x the speed of light. Roughly

Roughly.  Likely a case of a vast decimal rounded to 4 siggies for sanity.

56 minutes ago, Archgeek said:

Roughly.  Likely a case of a vast decimal rounded to 4 siggies for sanity.

So 863,102,487 m/s, roughly
Praise the Kraken.  Fear the Kraken.

14 hours ago, Cadet_BNSF said:

So 863,102,487 m/s, roughly

Not quite, you forgot the 4 significant digits.  2.789 * 299792458m/s should be rounded to 863100000m/s.  Roughly.

*suffers flashback to highschool chem class*

Edited March 2, 2017 by Archgeek

Another time was when i was sending a probe to escape kerbol. Only, when it crossed Jool's orbit, it started rapidly spinning, and self destructed.

lol

This kept happening on every quick load... restarting KSP fixed it

^ The explosions began with the wing hitting the launchpad...

right... it was a collision with the launchpad...

and the start of another set of explosions:

and another:

thankfully, I haven't had this happen in the updated versions (you can see that was before the whiplash got its new model)

I have no pics. But the Kraken apparently did not like my station so he shook the hell out of it. The station survived though not a scratch,

.

http://prntscr.com/eqy5n8

Linus Kerman: "I think someone put the camera on the side

Mortimer Kerman: "I personally think someone STOLE THE ROCKET"

(And the weirdest part? The rocket was still here, on the launch pad, waiting to burn, but the staging was apparently eaten by the kraken).

Back in 2014 I dropped a rover to explore the runway island and everything was going fine until I entered one of the hangers, at which point the screen suddenly changed...

 

... to this (well this before I EVA'd anyway).

 

Something didn't want me poking m nose where it didn't belong on that island and decided to rip the vehicle apart and teleport the brave explorer (Roley Kerman) and the lander can he was in to high above Kerbin, heading away from it at several km/s

 

A year or so later I sent another vehicle to the island as part of a challenge and after EVAing from it to have a look around, I noticed that his vehicle was slowly (about 1m/s) floating up into the air, which was probably the creepiest thing that I've seen in the game. After a couple of minutes of it slowly floating away I reloaded the game and all was fine.

It wasn't a small vehicle either, but the vehicle below. I'd missed the landing on the tower (requirement of the challenge) on my first attempt instead landing at the side of the runway, so when this thing started floating up in the air it look seriously weird.

Edited April 1, 2017 by purpleivan

*Le context*

I just hauled big sciency stuff to orbit, and now I'm deorbiting the probe with all the precious science. The parachute unfolds, no problem, and I decided to ditch the rather large heat shield. And suddenly...

After some zoom, I found out I had been relocated on the orbit of Dres...

I should probably visit it, the sooner the better. I think Dres got mad at me and decided to send the kraken on me...
Kerbals, the only lifeforms killed by random glitches.
